required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Green Propolis Extract (EPP-AF) on Inflammation in Hemodialysis Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Green Propolis Extract (EPP-AF) on Inflammation in Hemodialysis Patients: a Randomized Cross-over Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

collaborator.agency: Alagoas State University of Health Science , Maceió , Brazil.

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: End-stage chronic kidney disease is associated with the condition of chronic inflammation. Patients on hemodialysis are known to be predisposed to several factors that predispose to inflammation: dialysis membranes, central venous catheters, oxidative stress, fluid overload, sodium overload, uraemic toxins. Propolis, a natural resin produced by bees from plant materials, has anti-inflammatory, immunomodulatory, and anti-oxidant properties. The aim of this study was to evaluate the impact of Brazilian green propolis extract on inflammation in hemodialysis patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized open-label cross-over trial to investigate impact of Brazilian green propolis extract on inflammation in hemodialysis patients.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized Cross-Over Trial. Each patient served as their own control.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in serum level of High-sensitivity C-reactive protein from baseline to end of study periods.
primary_outcome.description: Change in high sensitivity C-reactive protein from baseline to end of study periods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in serum level of Interleukin-1 Beta from baseline to end of study periods.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Interleukin-1 Beta from baseline to end of study periods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in serum level of alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, amylase and creatine kinase during the study, from baseline to end of study periods.
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety of propolis use in hemodialysis patients. Measurement of changes in serum level of alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, amylase and creatine kinase during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with adverse events during the study.
secondary_outcome.description: We will evaluate the presence or absence of symptoms related to the use of propolis through a questionnaire.

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Kidney Disease Requiring Chronic Dialysis

arm_group.description: Hemodialysis patients will be under regular treatment of their comorbidities and using Propolis.
Hemodialysis patients will be under regular treatment of their comorbidities, but without using Propolis.

intervention.description: Randomized, cross-over, open-label. Patients will go through two 4 week periods with 1 week washout between them. During the intervention period will use 250mg of green Propolis per day. In the control period they will only follow standard treatment for their comorbidities.
In the control period they will only follow standard treatment for their comorbidities.

overall_official.affiliation: Universidade Estadual de Ciências da Saúde de Alagoas

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital
